intro: Antirrhinum mazimpakae, commonly known as the Malawi snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Malawi. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cooler, temperate climates. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical studies.
